intro: Orchis sambucina f. purpurea, commonly known as the purple orchid or the purple twayblade, is a rare and striking member of the Orchidaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive purple-pink flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are elongated and grass-like, while its stems are often short and stout. This orchid is known for its limited distribution and is considered a conservation concern in many regions.
